definition: to try to score (a goal)/final push (at a critical juncture)/the final leg of sth
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
variant of 角[jue2]/role

sentences.english: We're putting the finishing touches on this year's Annual Product Directory.
sentences.chinese: 我们把今年的年度产品目录上的临门一脚。

sentences.english: I want to help with that last push, which is always the hardest.
sentences.chinese: 我想要尽一份力，因为临门一脚总是最困难的。

to make a breakthrough
lit. to fix the tone with a single hammer blow/fig. to make the final decision
bottleneck
lit. where water flows, a canal is formed (idiom)/fig. when conditions are right, success will follow naturally
the time is right, geographical and social conditions are favorable (idiom); a good time to go to war

definition: the will is there, but not the strength (idiom)/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak

fault/mistake/to miss (a chance)
the road to happiness is strewn with setbacks (idiom)
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
lit. to clasp the Buddha's feet when danger arises (idiom); fig. to profess devotion only when in trouble/doing things at the last minute/making a hasty last-minute effort
final exam/to take an end-of-term exam/(Tw) college entrance exam (abbr. for 大學入學考試|大学入学考试[da4 xue2 ru4 xue2 kao3 shi4])
one's bicycle chain comes off/(fig.) to let sb down/to drop the ball/to screw up
